topic.title: Database Change Protocol
topic.shortdesc: Database Change Protocol (DCP) is the protocol used to stream data changes to buckets.

body.p: The Database Change Protocol (DCP) is a streaming protocol that significantly reduces latency for view updates. With DCP, changes made to documents in-memory are immediately streamed to be indexed without being written to disk. This provides faster view consistency which provides fresher data. DCP reduces latency for cross-dataceter replication. Data is replicated memory-to-memory from the source cluster to the destination cluster before being written to disk on the source cluster.
